channel.title: coastal on The Ocean Code
channel.description: Recent content in coastal on The Ocean Code

item.title: Transects
item.description: Preface This week I have expanded the coastR package with the inclusion of a function that calculates the angle of the heading for alongshore or shore-normal transects. The rest of this blog post is the vignette that I’ve written detailing the set of this function. Next week I’ll likely be taking a break from coastR development to finally create a package for the SACTN dataset. That is a project that has been in the works for a loooong time and it will be good to finally see a development release available to the public.

item.title: Predominant Atmospheric and Oceanic Patterns during Coastal Marine Heatwaves
coastR package
item.description: An R package with useful functions for coastal oceanography.

item.title: Sequential sites
item.description: Preface The rest of the blog post after this preface section is a copy of the vignette I’ve written for the first function in the new package I am developing: coastR. This package aims to provide functions that are useful for coastal oceanography but that do not yet exist in the R language. It is not my intention to provide algorithms for physical oceanography as these may already be found elsewhere.

item.title: Nearshore and offshore co-occurrence of marine heatwaves and cold-spells
